Body: Baker made 170 cakes. He sold 78 of them and bought 31 new cakes.
Question: How many more cakes did baker sell than those he bought?

Body: Shirley sold 25 cases of boxes of trefoils.
Question: How many boxes of trefoils does she need to deliver if each case has 14 boxes?

Body: We ordered 17 pizzas. Each pizza has 4 slices. If there are 25 of us
Question: How many slices of pizza are there altogether?

Body: There were 12 roses and 2 orchids in the vase. Jessica cut some more roses and orchids from her flower garden. There are now 10 roses and 21 orchids in the vase.
Question: How many orchids did she cut?

Body: White t - shirts can be purchased in packages. If mom buys 66 white t - shirts where each package has 3 white t - shirts.
Question: How many packages will she have?

Body: Mary is baking a cake. The recipe calls for 5 cups of flour and 14 cups of sugar. She already put in 10 cups of flour and 2 cups of sugar.
Question: How many more cups of sugar does she need to add?

Body: Mom buys 51 white t - shirts. If white t - shirts can be purchased in packages of 3
Question: How many packages will she have?

Body: Adam could fit 8 action figures and 10 cabinets on each shelf in his room. His room has 4 shelves.
Question: How many total items could his shelves hold?

Question: How many slices are there in each pizza?

Body: Baker made 144 cakes. He sold 71 of them. Then he made 111 more cakes.
Question: How many more cakes did baker make than those he sold?
